FacilityName: Farmers Elev. Coop. - Rock Rapids NH3
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Storage Vessels removed and product is no longer stored or distributed in plant

_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Applicable building, electrical, and plumbing codes. This facility complies with the Iowa Fertilizer Law.
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: We utilize those portions of these codes which are deemed applicable by the jurisdictional authority
_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vandalism/Theft (methamphetamines). Provisions have been made to install protective barriers around the perimeter of the bulk storage plant to reduce potential of vehicular damage.
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Flow Limiters=what in the trade is called an excess flow valve. Break-away couplers have also been installed at the risers.
_prev_prog_2.MS_OtherType: Regular plant inspection/Routine preventive maintenance & repair
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Pumps, pump seals, pipes and plumbing, valves, electrical equipment, and safety equipment. Break-away couplers, pressure relief valves,and hoses are also inspected.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION/EMERGENCY RESPONSE AT FARMERS ELEVATOR COOPERATIVE, ROCK RAPIDS, IOWA.

This facility complies with ANSI Standard K-61.1-1989 requirements with amendments for Anhydrous Ammonia storage. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local regulations. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to immediately notify the Rock Rapids Volunteer Fire Department (via a 911 call) and request that it respond to the emergency. Incidental to the notification to the fire department, a call to the Region 3 Emergency Planning District will be made.

While we have planned for an emergency, it is acknowledged that a real emergency will be unexpected and may very well be much different and cannot be ensured to duplicate what may have be planned. In reality, the situation that develops may not happen in the manner in which it has been planned. In that event, what may have been planned will serve only as a guideline to follow.

The Emergency Action Plan for this facility describes certain procedures that are intended to minimize the hazards associated with human health and the environment from fires, explosions, the sudden and unexpected release of chemicals (i.e., Anhydrous Ammonia), tornadoes, bomb threats or other accidents or acts of God which might occur on our premises.

The primary emergency coordinator for the Rock Rapids, Iowa location is WEs Koedam, location  manager. His work and 24-hour emergency response telephone numbers are provided in the Registration Section of this document. In addition, the following individuals (with associated work and 24-hour emergency response telephone numbers) are to be contacted in order:

                      Wes Koedam, location manager
                               WORK:    (712) 478-4401
                               24-Hour:   (712) 472-4127
                               Home:        (712) 470-4805

                      Ron Dinger,  operations

(712) 472-2515

                      Larry Wendland, operations

                                24-hour:    (507) 967-2187

DESCRIPTION OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE/DISTRIBUTION PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED AT FARMERS ELEVATOR COOPERATIVE, ROCK RAPIDS, IOWA:

This facility is a portable anhydrous ammonia nurse tank parking lot and staging area which is used only on a seasonal basis. The portable anhydrous ammonia nurse tanks that are parked at  this facility is distributed to agricultural crop producers in the surrounding area who utilize the anhydrous ammonia for crop nutrient purposes. 

From time-to-time throughout the year as many as ten (10) 1,000-gallon nurse tanks may also be present at this site. The anhydrous ammonia plant is only operated on a seasonal basis (Spring and Fall). Full-time equivalent employee numbers were computed on that basis. At a maximum, the plant operates a total of three months (1/4 of the year). The FTEs for this company location is one (1).

THE WORST-CASE AND ALTERNATIVE  RELEASE SCENARIOS:

The worst-case scenario is the failure of one (1) 1,000-gallon nurse tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% of capacity), resulting in the release of the total volume in a gaseous (hazardous ammonia vapor cloud) form. According to EPA's RMP*Comp Program (Version 1.07), the distance to the endpoint is 0.9 miles.

The alternative release scenario involves the transport delivery vehicle pulling away from the intake lines into the storage plant without disconnecting the transfer hoses. The resulting release, according to EPA's RMP*Comp Program has a distance to endpoint of 0.1 miles.

The system is protected from major releases by internal excess flow valves, check valves, relief valves, and manual shut-off val

ves. 

Since this facility is located in relatively close proximity to the Town of Rock Rapids, provisions have been designed to notify all affected persons. An evacuation plan is in place.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable State and local codes and regulations. The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with ANSI Standard K-61.1-1989 with amendments and State law. 

In addition the company has specific operating procedures in place intended to minimize the potential for an accidental (and potentially catastrophic) release of anhydrous ammonia. Finally, Farmers Elevator Cooperative has extended to the Rock Rapids Volunteer Fire Department the opportunity to visit our anhydrous ammonia plant, to participate in mock emergency simulation training, and to avail themselves of specific anhydrous ammonia health hazard information and training provided by the company.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

Farmers Elevator Cooperative, Rock Rapids, Iowa has never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is the policy of Farmers Elevator Cooperative  to immediately notify the Rock Rapids Volunteer Fire Department and the Region 3 Emergency Planning District to request that they respond to the emergency. In the unlikely event that the Rock Rapids Fire Department is unable to adequately respond to an emergency at our Rock Rapids location, the Volunteer Fire Department with whom Rock Rapids has a reciprocal agreement will be summoned.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department and Region 3 Eemergency Planning District. Members of the fire department and the LEPC have inspected our anhydrous ammonia pl

ant. In addition, copies of photographs taken of our plant have been provided (for reference) to both entities.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

The plan is to minimize those hazards to human health and to the environment that are associated with accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. Employees working at the bulk storage plant make routine observations prior to and during transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the storage vessel(s) to nurse tanks. In so doing, they are able to detect problems before they arise. This routine inspection identifies any portion of the system which may be under stress or about to fail. Repairs can be made before they become problematic. Employees are annually trained to recognize the hazards associated with storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. In addition to annual training for employees who have been on the job for a number of years, the company conducts training for new hires. This training includes classroom instruction, on-site training at the plant, and follow-up observation to determine their individual comprehension and understanding of the new hire. Finally, the company routinely invites  local fire department personnel to visit the site. In the event that the local fire department requests assistance in training its employees on anhydrous ammonia, the company cooperates fully in their endeavors.
